main_definition: The process of determining the relationship between two or more sets, often used to visually represent this relationship.

meanings_and_examples.example: A map showing different countries and their boundaries.
Creating a bar graph to represent the sales data of a company over time.
A function that assigns each element from one set (domain) to an element of another set (codomain). For instance, f(x) = 2x maps every number x to its double.
A function that translates data from one format or structure into a different one, like converting text to uppercase (e.g., mapping 'hello' to 'HELLO').
The cognitive process whereby individuals form an internal representation of the spatial properties and relationships in their environment.
